attributes.action: Establish a new body to represent NHS workers and develop Covid recovery plan
attributes.additional_details: Having travelled the UK to meet NHS victims & heard their difficulties when things go wrong e.g. being unable to get the right treatment, unable to work or not assisted by MPs. Of major concern are those who have contracted Covid-19 through work, have ongoing health issues or are low paid. If unable to work, they may face problems with DWP, PIP, housing & other issues. The government need to reform the whole system to ensure they have access to the right help & are treated well.
attributes.background: The Government should establish a new body to represent NHS doctors, nurses & key frontline workers, to discuss & decide the best package to address the long-term effects on mental/physical health due to the impact of Covid-19 which has left a lasting scar with over 121,674 + lives lost nationwide

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care
